goals__remit:
WEED was founded in 1990 to boost lobby and advocacy activities in Germany on issues surrounding the global economy, poverty alleviation and international environmental problems. WEED campaigns for a broad correction in international economic and development policies that would put social justice and economic sustainability in the centre of international policy-making. 
WEED's aim is to create more awareness in this respect and develop and implement concrete political alternatives. The current working fields are financial markets, tax justice, production chains, sustainable procurement as well as trade and investment policy. WEED's work includes research and policy reports, fact sheets, media work, organizing conferences and workshops, taking part in official consultations, campaignung and talks with civil servants and politicians.
relevant_communication:
Public Events (e.g. on Long Term Finance and on Debt Workout) 
Expert Events 
Talks with civil servants 
Talks with politicians and their assistants 
Talks with business 
Media work (articles, interviews, background talks) 
Reports and policy papers 
Networks 
Eductional work (toolkits, school events)
